page.title: 13FRISKNEY ALL SAINTS CHURCH
page.content: The present church was founded in 1247. Parts of the original Norman church (1135) still exist. The church has been extensively added to over the years. An outstanding feature are the murals which were rediscovered last century. The church has 48 acres of land let in 1 or 2 acre plots to agricutural workers. The income was used to pay the Schoolmaster but it is now used for the upkeep of houses for the elderly and the Christmas Distribution. The church plays an active part in village life-Mothers Union, Sunday School, bellringers, magazine, choir and many and various fund-raising events.The parish has combined with Thorpe and the the Rev R.File is Vicar for the combined parish. There are plans for a new Vicarage to be built near the existing one.
